noun.description: A large-headed piece of metal that pierces and projects from a surface, especially for decoration.
An upright support in the wall of a building to which sheathing, drywall, etc., are attached.
A rivet or crosspiece in each link of a chain cable.

verb.description: Decorate or augment (something) with many studs or similar small objects.
examples: a dagger studded with precious diamonds

origin: Old English stōd, of Germanic origin; related to German Stute mare, also to stand.
